string.text: I don't mind talking about it.
I was the governor of a castle on the Kuzhait border and successufully defended it in many sieges. It was my pride to be able to keep it prosperious and feared by our enemies.
I was maybe a bit too successful as a local noble got jealous. He was scared i could overshadow his skills. So he asked me to leave, suggesting that he would emprison me for any reason he could find.

I'm not into politics so I refused to leave. Consequently, he claimed I had stolen gold from the treasury and hidden some in my personal quarters, which forced me to leave without any of my belongings.
It's your version of the story, maybe you are simply a well dressed robber.

I wish i could have a second chance; I am forced to spend my time in taverns, taking whatever work can be found. If i can get another settlement to manage I'll prove that it's possible to keep it both prosperous and secure.
I know how to fight and manage a settlement, but I am also able to do engineer or trader jobs without much trouble.
